pages.title: About CovertConvert - Free Private Image Converter
pages.description: CovertConvert is a free image converter that works entirely in your browser. Your files never leave your device.
pages.content:
CovertConvert is a free image converter built for people who value their privacy.

Why We Built This

Most image converters upload your files to their servers. That means your personal photos, documents, and images pass through someone else's computers. We thought there had to be a better way.

CovertConvert processes everything locally in your browser. Your files never leave your device. There's no upload button because there's nothing to upload to.

How It Works

We use modern web technologies like WebAssembly to run image conversion code directly in your browser. It's like installing software, but without the install. Your browser does all the work.

What We Support

  • HEIC/HEIF - iPhone photos
  • WebP - Modern web images
  • AVIF - Next-gen compression
  • TIFF - Professional photography
  • PNG, BMP, GIF - Common formats

Convert to JPEG for smaller files or PNG for lossless quality.

No Limits, No Catches

Because we don't run servers to process your files, we don't have server costs to cover. That means genuinely unlimited conversions. No daily limits. No file size restrictions. No premium tier upsells.

pages.title: Privacy Policy - CovertConvert
pages.description: CovertConvert's privacy policy. We don't collect your files because we never receive them. Simple as that.
pages.content:
We don't collect your files because we never receive them.

The Short Version

Your images are converted entirely in your browser. They never leave your device. We couldn't see them even if we wanted to.

What We Don't Collect

  • Your files (we never receive them)
  • Your personal information
  • User accounts (we don't have any)
  • Passwords (none to store)

What We Do Collect

We use Google Analytics to understand how people use the site. This includes:

  • Pages visited
  • General location (country/city level)
  • Device type and browser
  • Conversion events (that you started/completed a conversion - not the files themselves)

This data is anonymous and helps us improve the site.

Cookies

We only use cookies for Google Analytics. No tracking cookies, no advertising profiles, no third-party data sharing beyond basic analytics.

Verify It Yourself

Don't take our word for it. Open your browser's developer tools (F12), go to the Network tab, and convert a file. You'll see that nothing is uploaded. The only network requests are for loading the page itself.

Last updated: December 2024

pages.title: How It Works - CovertConvert Technical Explanation
pages.description: Technical explanation of how CovertConvert processes images entirely in your browser using WebAssembly, without uploading files.
pages.content:
A technical look at how CovertConvert processes your images without uploading them anywhere.

The Traditional Way (What We Don't Do)

Most image converters work like this:

  1. You upload your file to their server
  2. Their server converts it
  3. You download the result

This means your files pass through someone else's computers. Even if they promise to delete them, you have no way to verify that.

Our Approach: Everything Stays Local

CovertConvert works differently:

  1. You select files (they stay on your device)
  2. Your browser reads and converts them locally
  3. Converted files download directly from your browser

No upload. No server processing. No trust required.

The Technology Behind It

WebAssembly (WASM)

WebAssembly lets us run high-performance code directly in your browser. We use it for formats like HEIC and AVIF that browsers can't natively decode. The conversion libraries (libheif for HEIC, Squoosh codecs for AVIF) run entirely client-side.

Canvas API

For encoding output (JPEG, PNG), we use the browser's built-in Canvas API. This is standard web technology that's been available for over a decade.

Blob URLs

Converted files are created as Blob objects in memory and downloaded via temporary URLs. These exist only in your browser session and are cleaned up automatically.

Verify It Yourself

You don't have to trust us. Here's how to verify:

  1. Open Developer Tools (F12 or right-click â†’ Inspect)
  2. Go to the Network tab
  3. Convert a file
  4. Watch the network requests

You'll see requests for the page assets (HTML, CSS, JS, WASM codecs), but no outgoing requests containing your file data. The conversion happens entirely in your browser.

For the Security-Conscious

Filter the Network tab by "fetch" or "xhr" to see only data requests. During conversion, you'll see zero outgoing data requests. The only traffic is loading static assets.

This architecture means CovertConvert works in environments where other converters are blocked - including corporate networks, healthcare systems, and legal firms where data can't leave the premises.
